notes
property.value:
Red Sun Over China: The Second Sino-Japanese War

by Pulicat

Version 2.3


Credits: Pulicat (creator and map design), erik542 (balance and playtesting), Veqryn (troubleshooting and general awesomeness). Thanks to all players and testers such as lalapalooza and everybody else!

Thanks for playing RSOC! If you would like to help contribute, please send your savegame to: pulicat01 [at] gmail [dot] com, since game balance is still being evaluated! Thanks! -- Pulicat

SPECIAL REMINDERS:

1) Movement from one side of an enemy city to another is technically possible, but is considered ILLEGAL.

2) Manchukwo, Japanese, and British may build ONLY in FACTORIES.

3) British are not allowed to fight Axis for the first 3 rounds (Phase I), unless any Axis country attacks it first.

The rules listed in the special reminder above are unique to this mod, but unfortunately TripleA cannot code for their automatic implementation. TripleA will not automatically enforce the rule and you must keep the rules in mind yourself and take care to not violate the rules.



Countries
Axis Powers
  • Japan (capital: Japan)
  • Manchukwo (capital: Mukden)
  • Thailand (capital: Bangkok)


Allied Powers
  • Nationalist (capital: Chungking)
  • Communist (no capital, the flag in the map is merely decoration)
  • British (capital: Calcutta)


Movement

Movement Through Cities
All territories bordering on a city is considered adjacent to each other, but players may only use this indirect connection if they control the city during that combat or noncombat movement phase. Movement from one side of an enemy city to another is therefore technically possible with TripleA, but is considered ILLEGAL.

Railroads
Railroad lines are marked on the map as dotted lines connecting the railroad stations. Two stations are considered connected if there exists a direct dotted line path between them. Trains may move between stations only if:
1) Friendly powers own the two cities to which the stations belong.
2) Friendly powers own the territories through which the rail line passes.
You must have control of a rail on at the beginning of your turn in order to use it.
Since attacking trains is considered a form of strategic bombing, only bombers may attack trains.
*Optional rule: Players may agree to edit-delete all enemy trains in a station if the city is captured.


Movement Restrictions
-Thailand cannot move outside of Thailand, neutral Indochina, and all the original British territories. You can tell which territories belong to the Thailand sphere of movement by looking at the relief tiles--they are the only ones with English words/Roman letters appearing in the background texture.
-Communists cannot enter Thailand, neutral Indochina, and all the original British territories.
-Nationalists cannot enter Thailand or Indochina.

National Objectives

War with Western United States
Phase II represents the United States entering the war, which will happen automatically at the beginning of Round 4. During Round 4 Nationalist combat move, move the marker over from Phase I to Phase II. If any Axis power attacks the UK before Round 4, then you enter Phase II at the next Nationalist combat turn.. Phase II gives +40 to the British and the Nationalists each.

Note: During Phase I the UK is not allowed to attack Axis either.

National Objectives List
Nationalists--
(+40) Phase II: "Phase II" button is ON.
(+20) Burma Road: Allies control Myitkyina, Chindwin, East Assam, Momein, and Puel.
(+10) The Hump: Western Allies entered war, Allies control East Assam and Kunming, AND Allies have lost control of the Burma Road.
(+?) Control of Central China: Nanking, Wuhan, Nanchang, and Changsha are worth 20, 20, 10, and 10 PUs respectively.
(+20) Control of South China: Allies control Canton and Nanning.

Communists--
(+5) Communist Quarantine: Other Allies have no units in any of the Communist starting territories.
(+5) China-Soviet highway: Allies control Chiu-Chuan, Hehsi Corridor, and Lanchow.

Britain--
Burma:
(+40) Phase II is ON.
(+5) Allies controls Mandalay.
(+5) Allies controls Sittang.
(+5) Allies controls Rangoon.

Japan--
(+10) Indochinese resources: Axis controls Luang Prabang, South Laos, Cambodia, Cochinchina, Annam, Tonkin, and Hanoi.
(+30) Operation Ichi-Go: Axis controls Kweilin, Chih-Chiang, Wu Tang Mountains, and Ichang
(+30) Operation U-Go: Axis controls any 1 of: Imphal, Kohima, or Chittagong.
Defeat Colonial Strongholds:
(+5) Axis controls Malaya-Singapore.
(+5) Axis controls Hong Kong.
(+5) Axis controls Rangoon.
(+5) Axis controls Mandalay.
Thailand--
(+10) Territorial Intergrity: Axis controls Kra, Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Nakhon Sawan, Phitsanulok, and Udon Thani.
(+10) Indochinese resources: Thailand also gets 10 PU if Axis controls Luang Prabang, South Laos, Cambodia, Cochinchina, Annam, Tonkin, and Hanoi.


Production

-Communists produce all their units outside of factories, and may also build on newly captured territory. Communists may produce up to 3 units in each territory.

-Thailand produce all their units outside factories, and may ONLY build inside Thailand (their original starting territories). Thailand may produce up to 4 units in each territory.

-Nationalists may produce infantry, cavalry and conscripts outside of factories (in the countryside). All other units may be produced in factories only. Nationalists may produce up to 3 units in each non-factory territory.

-Japanese, Manchukwo, and British follow standard production rules (build all units in factories only, may NOT build outside of factories).

-Factories in China start out damaged. This is not a bug. All cities in China (except the Nationalist capital Chungking) start out with maximum damage. In order to get the factory operational, players must pay repair price. For all Allied powers, this surcharge is 2 PU. For the Japanese, it is 3 PU. In other words if the Japanese wanted to build more than just 1 unit per Chinese factory per turn, it costs them a premium of 3 PU per additional unit built.


Miscellaneous

Territory Ownership
Any territory recaptured from the Japanese within China belongs to the liberator, not initial owner.

Canals and map clarifications
The Strait of Malacca: Movement between SZ 17 Malay Sea and SZ 21 Strait of Malacca determined by control of Malaya-Singapore.
Pacific-Indian Ocean connection: SZ 22 and SZ 23 is a canal that can ONLY be controlled by the British after Phase II. It takes 2 spaces to move through that canal.
Himalayas: Borders marked with X marks indicate that a connection does not exist because of impassable Himalayan mountains.
Canton does not touch the ocean.
West Kwangtung touches Hong Kong.


Units Index


Unit Descriptions
Unit name att def move cost image / available to: description
Infantry 1 2 1 3 isSupportable, TransportCost:2
Elite 2 2 1 4 isSupportable, TransportCost:2
Armour 3 3 2 6 canBlitz, TransportCost:3
Heavy Artillery 3 2 1 5 givesSupport, TransportCost:3
Light Artillery 2 2 2 5 givesSupport, CANNOT Blitz,, TransportCost:3
Fighter 3 4 5 15 canLandOnCarrier
Bomber 4 1 9 20 canDoSBR
Transport 0 0 2 8 Capacity:5
Submarine 2 1 2 7 isSubmarine
Destroyer 2 2 2 8 isDestroyer
Cruiser 3 3 2 12 canBombard
Carrier 1 2 2 16 Transport up to 2 air units
Battleship 4 4 2 20 isTwoHit, canBombard
AAGun 0 1 1 5 isAA, TransportCost:3
Cavalry 1 1 2 3 canBlitz, isSupportable, TransportCost:3
Factory 0 0 0 30 only British can build new isFactory
Cargo Train 0 0 6 8 Capacity:10, 6 movement = 2 stations
Armoured Train 0 1 0 10 Capacity:5, 6 movement = 2 stations
Conscript 1 1 1 2 is NOT supportable, TransportCost:2
Mobile Infantry 1 2 2 4 canBlitz, isSupportable, TransportCost:2
Light Armour 2 1 2 4 canBlitz, isSupportable, TransportCost:3
Heavy Cavalry 2 1 2 4 canBlitz, isSupportable, TransportCost:3
Light Infantry 1 1 2 2 canBlitz, is NOT supportable, TransportCost:2
Guerilla 1 1 3 3 This is an "air" unit, so it can't capture territory and must land on a friendly space. Cannot be transported.
Propaganda 0 0 20 1.5 canBlitz, is NOT supportable, Cannot be transported
Commando 2 2 2 4 can NOT Blitz, is NOT Supportable, TransportCost:2



Technical Details (for the interested):
-Territory Ownership: All territories initially under Communist control and all non-city territories initially under Nationalist control is attached "OccupiedTerritoryOf" Japan.
-City connections: Since a land-canal option is not yet available for TripleA, currently all city-canal connections are coded as regular connections.
-Railroads: Railroad stations are coded as water and trains as a kind of transport. For each of the 35 individual rail connections, two dummy sea zones had to be set up in the upper left hand corner ("Rail Connections" chart), thus totaling 70 dummy territories. This was so to allow all connections to be coded as canals, because otherwise TripleA will not allow multiple canal attachments to the same territory.
The structure follows this example of the Wuhan-Changsha connection:
(Wuhan)+[Wuhan-Changsha-Wuhan]=[Wuhan-Changsha-Changsha]+(Changsha)
where the real territories are the ones in (parentheses), the dummies in [brackets], the direct connections as +, and the canal connection as =. This degree of separation allows for bypassing game engine limitations.
